programming_cards.title: Aria
programming_cards.description: A voice-based AI assistant, with functions like weather forecasts, timezones, playing music, opening/closing apps, searching the internet. There is also a chat mode which makes use of the OpenAI chat completion API.

programming_cards.title: SimpleGPyT
programming_cards.description: A Python package with a simplified object-oriented interface for OpenAI's chat completion API. Available on PYPI and can be installed with 'pip install simpleGPyT'.

programming_cards.title: Fourier Transforms in C++
programming_cards.description: A C++ library with an FFT algorithm and a few useful applied FFT methods.

programming_cards.title: Ideal and Non-Ideal Gas Simulation
programming_cards.description: A simulation of ideal and non-ideal gasses in 2-dimensions as circles with elastic collisions. For collision detection, I made use of a spatial hash map, which allows the program to handle upwards of 2500 particles without any significant performance drop.

programming_cards.title: C Base Layer
programming_cards.description: Some basic C utilities including data structures, algorithms and various math structures such as vectors, matrices and useful mathematical algorithms.

programming_cards.title: Random Variable Distributions in C
programming_cards.description: A C library for generating Random Variables according to a few common probability distributions. Also contains a Python wrapper for the library.

programming_cards.title: ASCII Art Generator
programming_cards.description: A GUI and terminal program which can create an ASCII artwork from an image. The GUI is made using the tkinter module.

programming_cards.title: Gravity Simulation
programming_cards.description: A simple Newtonian gravity simulation written in Python which uses point masses to approximate different gravitational interactions. There are a few prebuilt systems in the code, such as our solar system and a binary star system with circumbinary planets.

programming_cards.title: Pathfinder
programming_cards.description: An app written in Java which allows the user to place a start point, end point and obstacles on a grid. The shortest path between the two points around any obstacles is then found and the process is visualized.

programming_cards.title: Sudoku Game
programming_cards.description: A sudoku game written in Java using the LibGDX framework. The game doesn't have preloaded puzzles, but rather generates a random new puzzle depending on the selected difficulty. This is done with recursive backtracking.

programming_cards.title: Wordle Clone
programming_cards.description: A clone of Wordle, written in Python using the pygame module.
